intro: Notopterygium tenuifolium, commonly known as slender-leaf notopterygium, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often used in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported therapeutic properties. Notopterygium tenuifolium thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes.
